author: @chardlau5617
text: I find the code:  for featureset in data:     if np.linalg.nor(featureset-centroid) < self.radius:         in_bandwidth.append(featureset)  should be replace with below:  for j in centroids:     if np.linalg.nor(centroids[j]-centroid) < self.radius:         in_bandwidth.append(centroids[j])  which take virtual centroid points into calculation in every loop.

author: @raulcavalcante9193
text: im getting tis error : fit() missing 1 required positional argument: 'data'  my code is this: import matplotlib.pyplot as plt from matplotlib import style style.use('ggplot') import numpy as np  X = np.array([[1, 2],               [1.5, 1.8],               [5, 8],               [8, 8],               [1, 0.6],               [9, 11],               [1, 3],               [8, 9],               [0, 3],               [5, 4],               [6, 4]])   colors = 10*["g","r","c","b","k"]  class Mean_Shift:     def __init__(self, radius):         self.radius = radius     def fit(self, data):         centroids = {}         for i in range(len(data)):             centroids[i] = data[i]         while True:             new_centroids = []             for i in centroids:                 in_bandwidth = []                 centroid = centroids[i]                 for featureset in data:                     if np.linalg.norm(featureset - centroid) <= self.radius:                         in_bandwidth.append(featureset)                 new_centroid = np.average(in_bandwidth, axis=0)                 new_centroids.append(tuple(new_centroid))             uniques = sorted(len(set(new_centroid)))             prev_centroids = dict(centroids)              centroids = {}             for i in range(len(uniques)):                 centroids[i] = np.array(uniques[i])             optimized = True             for i in centroids:                 if not np.array_equal(centroids[i], prev_centroids[i]):                     optimized = False                 if not optimized:                     break             if optimized:                 break         self.centroids = centroids      def predict(self, data):         pass clf = Mean_Shift clf.fit(X) centroids = clf.centroids  plt.scatter(X[:,0], X[:,1], s=150) plt.show()
